text: Highway 93 is a north–south route located in the southeastern region of British Columbia, Canada, within the Regional District of East Kootenay. It connects to U.S. Highway 93 at the Canada–United States border near Roosville, Montana. The highway continues northward, eventually crossing into Alberta at the Continental Divide via Vermilion Pass, where it becomes Alberta Highway 93. == Route Overview == Elko–Roosville Highway: The southern section of Highway 93, from the Canada–U.S. border to its junction with the Crowsnest Highway (Highway 3). Kootenay–Columbia Highway: The segment running between the Crowsnest Highway and Radium Hot Springs.Banff–Windermere Parkway: The eastern section of the highway, extending from Radium Hot Springs to the Alberta border. == References == Category:British Columbia provincial highways
title: British Columbia Highway 93
